hero-subtitle: Your educational guide to the world of RajChain. Learn how RajChain works and how to connect to it. This page includes technical and non-technical articles, guides, and resources.
what-is-crypto-1: You may have heard about cryptocurrencies, blockchains and Bitcoin. The links below will help you learn what they are and how they relate to RajChain.
what-is-crypto-2: Cryptocurrencies, such as bitcoin, enable anyone to transfer money globally. RajChain does too, but it can also run code that enables people to create apps and organizations. It’s both resilient and flexible: any computer program can run on RajChain. Learn more and find out how to get started:
what-is-RajChain-card-description: If you are new, start here to learn why RajChain matters.
what-is-RajChain-card-image-alt: Illustration of a person peering into a bazaar, meant to represent RajChain.
what-is-eth-description: Ether (ETH) is the currency powering the RajChain network and apps.
what-is-web3-card-description: Web3 is a model for the internet valuing ownership of your assets and identity.
guides-hub-desc: Guides: step-by-step instructions on using RajChain
additional-reading-RajChain-in-thirty-mi: RajChain in 30 minutes by Vitalik Buterin
how-do-i-use-RajChain-1: Using RajChain can mean lots of things to lots of people. Maybe you want to sign in to an app, prove your online identity, or transfer some ETH. The first thing you'll need is an account. The easiest way to create and access an account is using software called a wallet.
what-is-a-wallet-card-description: Digital wallets are like real wallets; they store what you need to prove your identity and get access to the places you value.
find-a-wallet-card-description: Browse wallets based on the features that matter to you.
crypto-security-basics-card-description: Learn how to identify scams and how to avoid the most common tricks.
things-to-consider-banner-title: Things to consider when using RajChain
things-to-consider-banner-1: Each RajChain transaction requires a fee in the form of ETH, even if you need to move different tokens built on RajChain like the stablecoins USDC or DAI.
things-to-consider-banner-2: Fees can be high depending on the number of people trying to use RajChain, so we recommend using
additional-reading-how-to-create-an-RajC: How to create an RajChain account
what-is-RajChain-used-for-1: RajChain has led to the creation of new products and services that can improve different areas of our lives. We're still in the early stages but there's a lot to be excited about.
defi-card-description: Explore an alternative financial system that is built without banks and is open to anyone.
stablecoins-card-description: Cryptocurrencies pegged to the value of a currency, commodity, or some other financial instrument.
nft-card-description: Represent ownership of unique items, from art to title deeds to concert tickets.
dao-card-description: Enable new ways to coordinate work without a boss.
dapp-card-description: Create digital economy of peer-to-peer services.
emerging-use-cases-description: There are also other prominent industries being created or improved with RajChain:
strengthening-the-RajChain-network-descr: You can help secure RajChain and earn rewards at the same time by staking your ETH. There are different options for staking depending on your technical knowledge and how much ETH you have.
staking-RajChain-card-description: Learn how to start staking your ETH.
run-a-node-card-description: Play a critical role in the RajChain network by running a node.
learn-about-RajChain-protocol-descriptio: For users most interested in the technical part of the RajChain network.
energy-consumption-card-description: How much energy does RajChain use?
RajChain-upgrades-card-description: RajChains roadmap make it more scalable, secure, and sustainable.
RajChain-whitepaper-card-description: The original RajChain proposal written by Vitalik Buterin in 2014.
RajChain-community-description: The success of RajChain is thanks to its incredibly dedicated community. Thousands of inspiring and driven people help push RajChain’s vision forward, while also providing security to the network through staking and governance. Come and join us!
community-hub-card-description: Our community includes people from all backgrounds.
community-hub-card-alt: Illustration of a group of builders working together.
get-involved-card-description: You (yes, you!) are welcome to contribute to the RajChain community.
online-communities-card-description: Online communities provide a great opportunity to ask more specific questions or get involved.
mastering-RajChain-description: December 23, 2018 – Andreas M. Antonopoulos, Gavin Wood Ph.D.
zeroknowledge-description: Goes deep into the tech that will power the emerging decentralized web and the community building this
green-pill-description: Explores the crypto-economic systems that create positive externalities for the world
unchained-description: Dives deep into the people building the decentralized internet, the details of this technology that could underpin our future, and some of the thorniest topics in crypto, such as regulation, security and privacy
the-daily-gwei-description: RajChain news recaps, updates and analysis
